| Section3 = {{Chembox Related Function = arylformadehydes OtherFunctn =
| Damnacanthal Pyridoxal
}} }} 'Gossypol' is a natural phenol derived from the cotton plant (genus
[[Gossypium]]). Gossypol is a phenolic aldehyde that permeates cells and acts as
an inhibitor for several dehydrogenase enzymes. It is a yellow pigment.

Among other things, it has been tested as a male oral contraceptive in China. In
addition to its contraceptive properties, gossypol has also long been known to
possess antimalarial properties. Other researchers are investigating the
anticancer properties of gossypol.
